payloads.description: Injects the SLEEP function with ORDER BY clause to induce a time delay.
Injects a time delay using the SLEEP function with an ORDER BY clause.
Injects a time delay with SLEEP and uses BENCHMARK to create a heavy load to further induce a delay.
Expands the previous injection by adding more columns in the ORDER BY clause.
Expands the ORDER BY clause further to test multiple columns.
Continues expanding the ORDER BY clause to introduce more columns.
Increases the number of columns in the ORDER BY clause to cause additional load.
Further expands the ORDER BY clause to test the system's response to multiple columns.
Increases the ORDER BY clause and continues to induce delays with BENCHMARK and SLEEP.
Injects further columns into the ORDER BY clause with SLEEP and BENCHMARK for additional delay.
Expands the ORDER BY clause to test if the system handles increasing complexity.
Increases the columns further in the ORDER BY clause to assess the system's performance under load.
Expands the ORDER BY clause to include more columns for a longer time delay.
Injects even more columns into the ORDER BY clause to maximize the time delay.
Adds more columns and induces an even longer delay by using SLEEP and BENCHMARK.
Further expands the ORDER BY clause with additional columns and more time delay.
Un simple payload pour tester l'injection SQL avec une pause de 5 secondes.
Augmenter encore la complexité avec 17 colonnes après l'injection.
Un payload avec 18 colonnes pour observer le comportement sous une pression accrue.
Test avec 19 colonnes, augmentant encore la charge sur la base.
Ajout de 20 colonnes pour tester la capacité de la base de données.
Injection SQL combinée avec un grand nombre de colonnes pour observer la stabilité.
